process-def.name: :RBA-AD-VMware_Infrastructure:Utilities:VM_Configuration_Operations:Construct Item for Update CD ROM Configuration

input.description:
Virtual machine used to make the method call.
Valid value: String

The display name of the virtual CD ROM device to be updated.
Valid value: String
Name of the datastore where the ISO file is stored. If the file is not located on a datastore, then this parameter should be empty or not specified.
canonical file path for the ISO image
Flag to specify whether or not to connect the device when the virtual machine starts.
Flag to allow the guest to control whether the connectable device is connected.

Flag indicating the device is currently connected. This flag is valid only while the virtual machine is running.
This flag is optional. If you specify the connected element, it is mandatory to specify values for the three connectable parameters start-connected, allow-guest-control, and connected.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <items> <item> <parameters> <virtual-machine>${virtual machine}</virtual-machine> <spec> <device-change-list> <device-change> <device> <cdrom>${cdrom}</cdrom> <backing> <xsl:if test="'${datastore}' != ''"> <datastore>${datastore}</datastore> </xsl:if> <file-name>${file name}</file-name> </backing> <xsl:if test="('${start connected}' != '' or '${allow guest control}' != '' or '${connected}' != '')"> <connectable> <xsl:if test="'${start connected}' != ''"> <start-connected>${start connected}</start-connected> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test=" '${allow guest control}' != ''"> <allow-guest-control>${allow guest control}</allow-guest-control> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="'${connected}' != ''"> <connected>${connected}</connected> </xsl:if> </connectable> </xsl:if> </device> </device-change> </device-change-list> </spec> </parameters> </item> </items> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Constructs <items> for Update CD ROM operation
